attributes.action: STOP Theddlethorpe site considered for radioactive waste disposal
attributes.additional_details: Theddlethorpe is located close to the sea and in a flood plain. We had an earthquake in 2008. The area is known for very rare species of plants and reptiles, which could be wiped out.
attributes.background: We want the Government and Parliament to reconsider using Theddlethorpe site for radioactive waste disposal.

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about the possibility of a geological disposal facility being developed in Theddlethorpe, but at this stage Radioactive Waste Management Ltd (RWM) is enaging with communities to identify a suitable location to host a geological disposal facility.

The Government has stated that before a decision is made to seek development consent from the Secretary of State, there must be a Test of Public Support by the community to demonstrate it is willing to host a GDF: https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/766643/Implementing_Geological_Disposal_-_Working_with_Communities.pdf

If and when a development consent order is sought from the Secretary of State we could accept a petition calling for this consent not to be granted.
